result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both Operating w/ PAC (2nd) and OWI (2nd). The defendant was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (2nd) and the other charge, OWI (2nd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Christopher A Hargot was found guilty of Resisting/Failing to Stop/Fleeing, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(2t).
  • Christopher A Hargot was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department.  Defendant shall pay the fine and costs at the rate of $100.00 a month beginning September 1, 2016.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
The jail sentence shall begin no later than October 30, 2016 at 4:30 pm.  The jail sentence may be served with huber and good time.    The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.  

Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA and comply with the driver safety plan.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Defendant Christopher A Hargot in court with attorney Damon P. Stichert.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea agreement put into the record. Attorney Tlusty is withdrawing her request to revoke the cash bond.  So ordered by the court.   Plea of no contest to the amended charge of fleeing and officer 346.04(2t)  - Count 1 and no contest to 346.63(1)(b) operating with PAC - 2nd - Count 3.  Plea colloquy.  Plea freely, knowingly and understanding.  Court dismisses Count 2 OWI 2nd - 346.63(1)(a) and Case No. 15TR881.  Court finds defendant guilty of counts 1 and 3.  Court orders in count 1 - court costs and DNA sample and surcharge.  Count 3 - the court orders fine - $1,429.00; $45.00 blood draw;  5 days county jail with huber to begin no later than October 30, 2016 at 4:30 pm with one day sentence credit; 12 month revocation of driver's license; IID and AODA.    The fine and costs are to be paid at the rate of $100.00 a month beginning September 1, 2016.   - rt

records.addlTxt: Initial Appearance on December 15, 2015 at 1:00 p.m.

Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the court. Defendant shall comply with booking procedures at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department. Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.
Arrest Report

Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant appeared in court in custody. Court found probable cause for the arrest. Court advised DE of right to attorney.  Notice of right to attorney given to defendant.  State requested a $1,000.00 cash bond with standard conditions and no operation of motor vehicle without valid driver's license and no possession or consumption of any alcohol.  Court ordered bond with conditions as requested.  Court informed defendant of OWI treatment court.  Initial appearance set for 12-15-15 at 1:00 p.m. ap
